data.question: What is the diameter of the double-helical octanuclear Cu(II) wheel synthesized?
Which metal ions can partially replace the central copper ions in the Cu(II) wheel?
Can the central copper ions in the Cu(II) wheel be fully exchanged by any other metal ions?
What method is used to achieve the cation exchange in the Cu(II) wheel?
data.answer: Immersing crystals into the aqueous solution of a certain metal salt

data.question: What is the effect of central metal ion exchange on the properties of the crystalline material?
data.answer: It significantly alters the properties of the material

data.question: What is the role of telmisartan in the synthesis of the Cu(II) wheel?
data.answer: It acts as a flexible ligand

data.question: What happens to the Cu(II) wheel when it undergoes cation exchange with zinc ions?
data.answer: It transforms into a Zn-Cu complex while retaining its original shape

data.question: Does the cation exchange process preserve the original structure of the Cu(II) wheel?
data.answer: Yes, if the coordination ability of the in-going metal ions is similar to that of the central metal ions

data.question: How does the catalysis activity of the Cu(II) wheel change after cation exchange?
data.answer: It shows little change in catalysis activity for oxidation of 2,6-di-tert-butylphenol

data.question: Do the Zn-exchanged and Co-exchanged products of the Cu(II) wheel show different antitumor properties?
data.answer: Yes, they show different IC50 values for the cell lines EC109

data.question: Is the gas sorption property affected by central metal ion exchange?
data.answer: Yes, there are large differences in H2 sorption among the complexes

data.question: True or False: The Cu(II) wheel can only be synthesized using telmisartan.
True or False: The Cu(II) wheel's structure collapses upon cation exchange with zinc ions.
True or False: The antitumor activity of the Cu(II) wheel is enhanced after cation exchange with cobalt ions.
True or False: The Cu(II) wheel and its cation-exchanged variants have identical gas sorption properties.
True or False: The Cu(II) wheel retains its double-helical structure after full exchange with trivalent iron ions.
True or False: The catalysis properties of the Cu(II) wheel are completely lost after cation exchange.
True or False: The synthesis of the Cu(II) wheel requires a high-temperature reaction environment.
